text:
QUEEN OF BATTLE
SERIES THREE
27- -THE ORDNANCE CORPS
the Army’s largest corps issues, maintains and repairs the
equipment that keeps the American combat soldier ready
28- -ANTIAIRCRAFT DEFENSE
America’s cities are protected from enemy air attack by the
famed Nike, developed and operated by the Army
29- -THE ARMY’S MISSILES
meet the Army’s family of guided and free-flight missiles, a
key to success on tomorrow’s battlefield
30- -THE ARMY’S CRIMINAL INVESTIGATORS
the Criminal Investigation Division solves a crime with highly
scientific cunning in this dramatic who-dunnit
31- -THE ARMY FIELD PRINTING PLANT
a little known part of the Army picture that plays a big role
in getting the word to the combat and student soldier
32- -SERVICE AND PATRIOTISM
liberty and freedom, keywords of American patriotism, give real
meaning to military service
33- THE COMBAT ARM OR DECISION
the strength of shock action, firepower, mobility and armor it¬
self make Armor an indispensable ally of the infantryman
34- THE NATIONAL GUARD
America’s oldest military unit has always answered the call to
arms. Today it offers a challenge to teen-agers
35- -ALL READY ON THE HOME FRONT
the United States Army Reserve’s “take six’’ plan arms the Nation
with a large citizen army, combat ready with a minimum of training
36- -ARMY ECONOMY
“economy’’ takes a serious meaning when it conserves the strength
of the Army and the Nation
37- A COMBINATION OF IDEALS
intangible benefits and satisfactions are strong reasons why the
Army life is an honorable and rewarding one
38- -THE TRANSPORTATION CORPS
the Army moves as the Transportation Corps moves. In the age
of speed, their job becomes increasingly more complex
39- A GI’S LETTER
one GI tells why he decided to make the Army his career. He
speaks for the Nation’s hard core of professional, dedicated soldiers
